abstracts.cdata!:
It is expected that the overall impacts
            of the Water Utility Improvement Project will be beneficial,
            since the sewerage projects will improve sanitary conditions
            on the high density residential areas in Skopje, Bitola, and
            Prilep. Nonetheless, during construction, adverse
            environmental impacts will occur, namely noise, and dust
            pollution, as well as pollution due to increased traffic on
            local roads. In addition, groundwater abstraction from the
            Vardar River, will adversely affect river flows. The
            Environmental Assessment addresses separately each of the
            three locations, providing the environmental baseline
            encountered, and, in accordance with the country's
            laws, and regulations, proposes mitigating measures as
            follows: 1) monitoring of groundwater levels, to establish
            the effect - on the river flows - of using groundwater for
            irrigation. Maximum abstraction levels are specified, to be
            phased out during a two year period; 2) construction should
            be limited to daylight schedules as a noise abatement
            measure; appropriate covers will control dust emissions;
            and, an efficient traffic management plan will limit
            congestion, and reduce public risk; 3) ecological protection
            include fencing, and the provision of alternative habitats,
            or relocation of flora, and fauna.
